meanings.definition: To prepare or set up in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always pretape my presentation to make sure it goes smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She likes to pretape her meals for the week on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to pretape their science experiment to avoid any last-minute mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The team pretaped their strategy for the game, ensuring they were well-prepared.
meanings.sent5: Before the trip, they pretaped their route on the map to avoid getting lost.

meanings.definition: A recording made in advance of a broadcast.
meanings.sent1: The radio station had a pretape of the interview ready to play.
meanings.sent2: The TV show used a pretape of the concert for the episode.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the pretape mishap during the live show.
meanings.sent4: The pretape of the news segment was accidentally played too early.
meanings.sent5: The pretape of the event captured all the highlights perfectly.
